name: W Hollywood

reviews.title: Typical W Cool and Hip, but lacking in many aspects
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights for a visit to my alma mater USC!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.text: - Typical W cool and hip that gives you the Wow factor everywhere you go, including the neon lights, "good morning/evening" carpets at elevator, the decor of the room, the hip decor at the lobby and the cool young crowd that it attracts (either hotel guests or restaurant guests)
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, but service level borders on criminal negligence

reviews.text: - I stayed at a Spectacular room and it gives a good view of the mountains and the outskirts of Hollywood
reviews.title: Hollywood Convenience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - The free Acura service that drives you within a certain radius (though I did not use this as the places I needed to go are beyond its free radius)
reviews.title: Hotel should read my letter to the GM and acknowledge it before adding me to its marketing spam list.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel - the room is very trendy, nice backlighting, very large TV. We stayed Sunday - Tuesday, we parked on the street since we were driving around LA - parking is free on Sunday and at night till 8am the following morning.
reviews.title: Beautiful Trendy Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The toiletries are very nice - lime scented, so nice we bought some at BLISS store. We used the Acura Limo service - very nice and courteous. The Lobby Bar is a great area - we had a fantastic Jazz Singer on Monday night, the place was packed !!
reviews.title: Gorgeous Hotel! Felt like celebrities!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Drais takes over the hotel pool on Sundays and bouncers are all around the hotel, but they recognised us instantly as guests and there were no problems getting in.
reviews.title: A bright spot in a bright city

reviews.text: We got the Hotel on Priceline for $100 and we asked and got an upgrade overlooking the inner courtyard with a view of the Capitol Records Building.
reviews.title: Hip, modern, right on Hollywood Blvd.

reviews.text: This hotel is so beautiful, modern and trendy! There are beautiful people everywhere! We were offered a sangria while waiting to check in which was delicious! Valet was $35 which was pricey, and you cannot park yourself. We were there on a Sunday night, and they have a "jazz night" in the lobby area which was crazy! There were TONS of people there! They had an awesome female jazz singer with burlesque dancers. It was really cool. We didn't try to go to the pool, but apparently the pool is for the nightclub Drai's which is next door and they have pool parties every Sunday. So, I did hear that even if you are a W guest, you have to wait in line like everyone else to get to the pool. We didn't even want to try and thought that was kind of odd that a hotel guest would have to wait in line to use the hotel's pool. Our room was so pretty and modern, which comfortable beds/linens. The bathroom in our room had a see through wall out into the room, so it wouldn't be ideal if you traveled with friends. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends! I would never stay here if I had kids!!
reviews.title: Nice suite, Mediocre Service

reviews.text: Our Stay at this hotel, Thurs to tues. May 31st to Tues. June 05. Thanks to all our stay was great. Many.many thanks for the upgrade. I always want to aquire my points. The check in was fast, friendly. At first, it was 2 people staying in a double room, I call the hotel a few days earlier to say a total of 4 people(my husband, myself,2 teenagers) were coming, thanks to the hotel the check in was great we were booked in a room w/ 2 queen beds. Housekeeping was great,no problem was communication always gave us what was needed. room service room quick, fast, great food. ( but costly). This Starwood Hotel calls your room for wake-up call even for more than one morning (yes, I have had a hotel not call my room for wake-up). The Rest. in the Hotel was great. Staff was so friendly, food was sooooo good. I loved the Subway was just outside the door, this was great when we would come back late at night.
reviews.title: Business/pleasure stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Security, I loved the security at this hotel. 1st. each entrance I had to show my room key to "get pass the ropes and walk to the elevator". If each person is going to a different floor,then u must use your room key for each floor. I liked those "checkpoints". My teenagers were able explore the hotel on their own. Yes, this hotel is not for little kids, but we knew this before I booked. The activity in the night club yes, u could hear it (I was on the 7th floor) but it was not all that bad.. My guess is the lower floor your room is, the noice level is greater. Our room on the 7th floor was quiet.We came back in to the hotel at different times of the day/night. We did not see any questionable people or actions.hint, hint. All of the people could not have been nicer from Guys at the front door,front desk, housekeeping, rest. etc. Having the Taxi always waiting outside 24/7 was great. they were some little things, but overall our stay was great. oh, the floor matts nice touch, they changed w/ the time of the day.
reviews.title: loved it!

reviews.text: we stayed here for the last 2 nights that we were in la and loved it! its very hip some would say a bit pretentious, so it depends what you are after from a hotel there were lots of young people in the lobby on the sunday night as there was a band playing. we were on the 9th floor and didnt hear any noise from the club on the roof. The pool is fab really nicely done and you even get a view of the Hollywood sign we were led round the pool one day and Nick cannon walked passed nobody batted and eyelid which was funny. ps free wifi!
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL

reviews.text: This hotel is excellent... We did not want to leave. I went on a Gemini girls trip. We stayed in a double room. We didn't have a view but who cares!!! LOL We were on Hollywood Blvd all we had to do was walk out the door and everything was there. We wanted to use the Acura service but it only went up to 4 miles and was only from 12 noon to 7 pm. But we realized after exploring everything was in walking distance. We didn't get a chance to eat at Delphine but we dick enjoy the rooftop pool Station and Living Room. The staff was nice and friendly. The room looks EXACTLY like the pictures... No fooling you when you get there. Everything was clean. The soap I think it was cucumber lemon was excellent! We didn't want to leave. We didn't get to enjoy Dria's because there was a private event going on. We were on the 6th floor we didn't hear any noise when it was time to sleep. ( the little sleep we did get) Overall great hotel.
reviews.title: Noise Factor
Insincere, shallow, superficial and incompetent. Hotel at its worst.
reviews.text: Typically impeccable W decor with a staff to match. My 8th floor room facing Hollywood Blvd on Friday and Saturday night treated me to all the disco beat sounds of the night club and the subsequent departing street traffic until 2:30 am. Add several rowdy intoxicated female guests carrying their argument between 2:30 and 3:30 am up and down the hall with assorted friends loudly trying to mediate their dispute, and I thought I was on set for the filming of a reality TV show. I had to call security twice when I would have rather been sleeping. I stayed at this W property because I love the chain and needed to be on the east side of LA. I'll likely stay elsewher if my next trip falls over a weekend.

reviews.title: They didn't judge me or my spanx
reviews.text: This is my favorite W Hotel because the customer service is so wonderful. I was in town for a quick trip that was packed with pre-dawn media interviews starting at 3 a.m. and a black tie event that same day at 5 p.m. I told the front desk about my unusual schedule because I knew that my only chance to sleep would be in the middle of the day. They found a room for me that was quiet and not near tons of other guests. They also made sure that housekeeping did not disturb me while I stole a few precious winks of sleep in the middle of the day. The staff truly won me over was when I tested the Whatever/Whenever service to the max by asking someone to come help me zip up my formal gown. One of the staff members was at my door to help in less than a minute. I will always stay at this hotel anytime I'm in the area.

Had a little gathering for my birthday in the W. Booked a cool corner suite since all other high end suites are taken. The pool was closed for private party. Not sure was because of the club downstairs or by some rich guy. But they mentioned it when I was making the reservation so it's ok.
reviews.title: Had a blast with friends but the Hotel is just ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is just like the picture on website. Still a little smaller than I expected. Decor is fashionable and state of the art as you expect from all the W hotels. Parking is $40 valet but there's an open garage across street for $10 overnight. Needed to wait for the room to be cleaned when I checked in at 5pm. The front desk guy said 10min but I waited 20 and the guy was gone for good. So asked another front desk lady for the keys. When walked in, the room was kinda cool but not surprising. The toilet was not flushed so that was terrible. After 10pm the hotel will be restricted to hotel guests only. Probably because of the night club's crowded people. One good thing is there's no complaint for the noise so I think the room is pretty sound proof.
reviews.title: Drais Pool Party

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Probably not gonna stay again for the listed price. But still pretty good place for friends gathering.
reviews.title: Great Property..Awesome Memorial Day Pool Party

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wife and I spent Saturday at the Drai’s pool party. It does not get any better than this. The vibe here is really fun with friendly people and great music. The service is terrific. I called the pool host, Chris, to set up our day in advance. Chris did an incredible job of taking care of us. Ask for him if you want to set up a great day. I will be going again very soon.
reviews.title: Worst W Hotel in the country for service

description: The W Hollywood Hotel is always ready for its close-up at the entertainment capital of the world's epicenter, where glitz, glamour, power shopping, vibrant dining, and cutting-edge style meet.
